items.title: VI Live: Malen-vervanger Watkins draait het eigenhandig om tegen Chelsea
items.summary: Goedendag en welkom in de VI Live van zaterdag 27 december. Hopelijk had u een fijne kerstperiode, en bent u klaar voor een fraaie dag vol voetbal. In dit blog hoeft u niks te missen van mooie affiches in onder meer ItaliÃ«, Engeland en Marokko.

items.title: Guardiola: 'Soms schreeuw ik tegen hem, soms zoen ik hem'
items.summary: Pep Guardiola geniet met volle teugen van Rayan Cherki bij Manchester City. Het ene moment wil de Spaanse succesmanager tegen zijn zomeraanwinst schreeuwen, maar op het andere moment kan hij hem wel zoenen. Zaterdag was dat laatste het geval na afloop van het duel met Nottingham Forest in de Premier League.

items.title: Arsenal in 'survival' mode as 'sensational' Raya save keeps them top
items.summary: David Raya's "sensational" second-half save keeps Arsenal top of the Premier League - with the Gunners in "survival" mode.

items.title: Van Dijk is trots na bijzonder moment met zoontjes van Jota
items.summary: Virgil van Dijk zal het moment dat hij zaterdagmiddag deelde met de zoontjes van Diogo Jota niet meer vergeten. Dinis en Duarte Jota mochten samen met de Nederlandse aanvoerder van Liverpool het veld betreden voor het duel met Wolverhampton Wanderers ( 2-1 ). Van Dijk sprak er na afloop over.

items.title: Slot prijst uitblinker Wirtz en fans van Liverpool en Wolves
items.summary: Arne Slot koestert de drie punten die Liverpool gepakt heeft in de thuiswedstrijd tegen Wolverhampton Wanderers. Het duel met Wolves zal ook de boeken ingaan als het duel waarin Florian Wirtz voor zichzelf de ban brak.

items.title: World Darts Championship: Littler, Bunting headline evening session LIVE!
Furieuze Dyche gaat los op arbitrage vanwege winnende City-goal Cherki
items.summary: Sean Dyche kon zijn ogen niet geloven tijdens Nottingham Forest - Manchester City zaterdagmiddag. De manager van The Tricky Trees gaf de arbitrage er van alle kanten langs omdat er volgens hem een overtreding zou zijn begaan bij de winnende treffer van The Citizens .

items.title: West Ham latest: Scarles in tears after error gifts Fulham late win
Arsenal should have won by more - Arteta
items.summary: Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta say his team's next step is to capitalise on their chances more and create bigger scorelines after a 2-1 win against Brighton.

items.title: Why England's wild MCG win only adds to Ashes frustration
items.summary: England's "hollow" Ashes victory in Melbourne brought about feelings of "huge frustration" as it showed just how different the series could have been had had they focused from the start.

items.title: 'Such an easy game to ref' - Dyche 'stunned' by 'bizarre' VAR calls
items.summary: Nottingham Forest manager Sean Dyche is critical of the officials over some "bizarre" decisions in his side's late 2-1 defeat by Manchester City.

items.title: 'We're not Barcelona' - but McInnes knows how Hearts can respond
items.summary: Derek McInnes knows his Hearts side are not Barcelona, but he knows what his team need to be if they are to sustain a Scottish Premiership title challenge.

items.title: Burnley rue missed chances in draw against Everton
items.summary: Burnley were left to rue some big missed chances against Everton in a 0-0 draw - but it could have been a precious three points.

items.title: Florian Wirtz nets first Liverpool goal to edge out Wolves on emotional day
items.summary: Liverpool and Wolves united in a moving tribute to Diogo Jota on the day Florian Wirtz finally scored the first goal of his slow-burning Anfield career. The lasting impression, however, was Liverpoolâ€™s relief at holding off a team that has endured more defeats in the first half of a season than any other in Premier League history. â€œIâ€™ve just said to the lads that Iâ€™m getting fed up with this,â€ said Rob Edwards, the Wolves manager. Edwards has been in charge for seven games, but deflation was understandable. Continue reading...

items.title: Schade hat-trick fires up Brentford to extend Bournemouthâ€™s winless run
items.summary: Antoine Semenyo appears in his final days as a Bournemouth player, departing a club with problems. Andoni Iraolaâ€™s status as a hot property is cooling amid difficult winter months. Bournemouth are the latest team to struggle after selling players to offset harsh financial winds. Of the Premier Leagueâ€™s set of â€œwell-runâ€, smaller clubs, perhaps Brentford, who climbed to eighth, are now the best example of how to flourish after losing key personnel. â€œDonâ€™t be down on yourselfâ€ was Keith Andrewsâ€™ recipe for his teamâ€™s successes after last summerâ€™s defection of the manager, Thomas Frank, the captain, Christian NÃ¸rgaard, and leading scorers Bryan Mbeumo and Yoane Wissa. â€œI think itâ€™s easy in this industry to look at what you havenâ€™t got. Look at what you didnâ€™t get rather than focus on what you have got.â€ Continue reading...

items.title: Ã˜degaardâ€™s strike and Rayaâ€™s wonder save help steer Arsenal past Brighton
items.summary: A few minutes before half-time in a contest that largely swung one way but briefly veered the other, Brighton threatened what was then a rare foray into Arsenal territory. For a short moment the visitors seemed certain to muster their first shot of an afternoon that had hitherto been miserable. But, no sooner had Maxim De Cuyper received the ball on the counterattack, the Belgian was flattened by a crunching Declan Rice tackle that killed any threat. De Cuyper slumped; Rice, towering over him, roared â€“ arguably this seasonâ€™s standout Premier League midfielder making light of playing right-back for the first time in his Arsenal career. Continue reading...

items.summary: Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola has endured frustration with Rayan Cherki, but not today.

items.title: We would have lost that game last season - Guardiola
items.summary: Pep Guardiola warned his players not to be overweight in the festive season - but there is little fat to trim at Manchester City who saw off Nottingham Forest at the City Ground.
